com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Class Capabilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Capabilities

  • public class Capabilities
extends Object
    This Capabilities class defines the capabilities of the user's Java code by encapsulating a list of attributes and parameters. During the initialization of the job, Java Integration stage will get its associated Capabilities object to learn whether the user's Java code can be run in the current job design.

    The default capabilities are:

    • Minimum number of input links is "0"
    • Maximum number of input links is "no upper limits(-1)"
    • Minimum number of output stream links is "0"
    • Maximum number of output stream links is "no upper limits(-1)"
    • Minimum number of reject links is "0"
    • Maximum number of reject links is "no upper limits(-1)"
    • Is Wave Generator : true
    • Column transfer behavior is all enabled.
    • Enable the user's Java code runs on conductor : false

    The users can specify the custom capabilities and pass to the Java Integration stage by overriding Processor.getCapabilities(). The following example shows how to customize the capabilities. 

     
 public Capabilities getCapabilities()
 {
    Capabilities capabilities = new Capabilities();
    capabilities.setMaximumInputLinkCount(1);
    capabilities.setMaximumOutputStreamLinkCount(2);
    capabilities.setMaximumRejectLinkCount(0);
    capabilities.setIsWaveGenerator(false);
    return capabilities;
 }

    If the current job design is not fit to the capabilities of user's code, the job will be aborted.

    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Processor.getCapabilities()

      • getMinimumInputLinkCount

        public int getMinimumInputLinkCount()
        Retrieves the minimum number of input links as capability of this stage.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of input links can be accepted by this stage.

      • setMinimumInputLinkCount

        public void setMinimumInputLinkCount(int count)
        Sets the minimum number of input links as capability of this stage. If a negative value is specified, this value will be ignored and then set to 0.
        Parameters:
        count - The minimum number of input links can be accepted by this stage.

        Sets the maximum number of input links as capability of this stage.
        Parameters:
        count - The maximum number of input links can be accepted by this stage. -1 indicates no upper limits.

      • isWaveGenerator

        public boolean isWaveGenerator()
        Retrives true if emits wave markers. If user's implementation will send a wave marker to the output link by using OutputLink.writeWaveMarker(), true should be returned. When running on Server canvas, a warning message will be output saying that wave generation is unsupported if implementation returns true.
        Returns:
        true if this stage emits wave marker. Otherwise, false.

      • setIsWaveGenerator

        public void setIsWaveGenerator(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets true if emits wave markers.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - true if this stage emits wave marker. Otherwise, sets false
        See Also:
        OutputLink.writeWaveMarker()

      • setColumnTransferBehavior

        public void setColumnTransferBehavior(int behavior)
        Sets the column transfer behavior set which the user code wants to use.
        Parameters:
        behavior - behavior set which user code wants to use.
        See Also:
        ColumnTransferBehavior

      • getColumnTransferBehavior

        public int getColumnTransferBehavior()
        Retrieves the column transfer behavior.
        Returns:
        behavior set
        See Also:

      • setIsRunOnConductor

        public void setIsRunOnConductor(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets true if the Processor's methods such as Processor.validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean), Processor.initialize(), and Processor.terminate(boolean) are called on the Conductor node for the stage initialization and termination processes.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - true if the Processor's methods are called on the Conductor node for the stage initialization and termination processes. Otherwise, sets false

      • isRunOnConductor

        public boolean isRunOnConductor()
        Retrieves true if the Processor's methods such as Processor.validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean), Processor.initialize(), and Processor.terminate(boolean) are called on the Conductor node for the stage initialization and termination processes.
        Returns:
        true if the Processor's methods are called on the Conductor node for the stage initialization and termination processes. Otherwise, false, which is the default return value.

      • setDesignTimeExtension

        public void setDesignTimeExtension(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.extensions.DesignTimeExtension extension)
        Sets the DesignTimeExtension instance. Non-null value indicates the connector supports the design time functionality such as metadata import or viewing data. Note that this functionality is only available for the custom connector stages built with Connector SDK tool.
        Parameters:
        extension - A DesignTimeExtension instance

      • getDesignTimeExtension

        public com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.extensions.DesignTimeExtension getDesignTimeExtension()
        Retrieves the DesignTimeExtension instance. Note that this functionality is only available for the custom connector stages built with Connector SDK tool.
        Returns:
        A DesignTimeExtension instance
